>

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Minecraft
messages.msgSnippet: My son and his friend set up a non-video Skype call and play Minecraft together.  That way they can chat but not slow down the computer. RobinS/V Lammeroo ...
messages.messageBody:
My son and his friend set up a non-video Skype call and play Minecraft together. That way they can chat but not slow down the computer. RobinS/V Lammeroo

---------- Original Message ----------
From: "Kristen" <goldfish_add@...>
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Minecraft
Date: Wed, 28 Sep 2011 08:05:40 -0000

OOOH! That sounds like fun. My daughter is a Minecraft player and I'm sure she'd be willing to show me how to play too (she doesn't read yet, so she'll probably want some help to play with people she can't voice-chat with).
She and my husband have a server that they play on together, but he deployed a few weeks ago and doesn't have much time to be online from where he is. I bet she would love a chance to play with some other kids.
We live in Japan, but we keep odd hours, so time zone shouldn't be a huge deal for us, either.

-Kristen

messages.msgSnippet: OOOH! That sounds like fun. My daughter is a Minecraft player and I m sure she d be willing to show me how to play too (she doesn t read yet, so she ll
messages.messageBody:
OOOH! That sounds like fun. My daughter is a Minecraft player and I'm sure she'd be willing to show me how to play too (she doesn't read yet, so she'll probably want some help to play with people she can't voice-chat with).
She and my husband have a server that they play on together, but he deployed a few weeks ago and doesn't have much time to be online from where he is. I bet she would love a chance to play with some other kids.
We live in Japan, but we keep odd hours, so time zone shouldn't be a huge deal for us, either.

-Kristen

messages.subject: Re: Minecraft
messages.msgSnippet: The Unschooling Gamers yahoo group has quite a number of active Minecraft players. http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/Unschooling_gamers/ It s not a very high
messages.messageBody:
The Unschooling Gamers yahoo group has quite a number of active Minecraft players.

http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/Unschooling_gamers/

It's not a very high traffic group, but folks come out of the woodwork to help others or to respond to requests for players.

messages.subject: Re: Minecraft
messages.msgSnippet: ** My son would love to play minecraft with other unschoolers!!  were in the process of trying to get a server up.  If anyone has children that would like to
messages.messageBody:
** My son would love to play minecraft with other unschoolers!! were in the process of trying to get a server up. If anyone has children that would like to play on a server (when its up)...I am going to dedicate it to homeschoolers only....let me know :) and I will send you the IP address. **


Wow, my boys (8 and 10) would LOVE to be able to join in on something like this. We've got a little local server running, but unfortunately it doesn't have enough capacity to be able to go public.

We're located in Australia, but they keep some very flexible hours, so I don't see time zones being too much of a problem.

Thanks heaps for this - I look forward to hearing when it is up and running.

- Tim
